title: When someone says 'Take your time', how much time is too much time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since, every question must be answered. Let's begin it. First of all, let's break this concept upto its nucleus. Time is a relative property. Everybody have his unique timezone, the set of actions and the time allotted to perform those chores respectively. , So as long as my timezone isn't clashing with yours, when we have to work together, you can take your time. Didn't get it ? Let's understand it in layman terms. “Take your time” is mainly used, when either you are : Taking a decisionPerforming an actionSuppose, you are sitting in an interview and you are thrown a quiz to solve and the panel says, “Take your time” then the time you will take, purely depends on: Are you taking a enough chunk of their time zone? Because, time is relative and everyone has different priorities, set according to their timezone. If they feel, you are not worthy then, your time allotted would be very less.Are there some other people waiting to be interviewed after you? So, are you taking their time also. Clashing time zone spotted!Or say, you have to make some big life decision then, you will have to give it another thought as long as you are comfortable to reach a final conclusion. Since, this “Take your time" is clashing with your own time zone. So, you don't have to worry much and you can take as long time as you want to reach to a result. So, final outcome is, if you take your time while dealing with your life, it can be granted. But, if you mess with some other's timezone then, you are fucked. Got it, Don't worry if you can't. Just take your time!
When some one says “take your time” that means you don't have much more time. You have to make your mind in peace . Find out the best solution for that problem.
